abstracts.cdata!:
The project would support the
            Government's economic recovery program and allow
            economic activity to expand while current and future reform
            measures are implemented. The adjusted program focusses on
            economic liberilization measures and reform of public
            administration and public enterprises. The policy package
            includes full decontrol of agricultural prices,
            simplification of tariffs and customs procedures,
            streamlining of conditions for investment and commercial
            activities, especially for industrial, mining and petroleum
            operations, and a complete overhaul of the banking sector.
            The public administration is to be reorganized and reduced
            by around 25,000 staff (some 30 percent) over the next 14
            months, after a comprehensive census, testing and
            rationalization process.
